questions.question_text:
When a stock manager receives a new delivery of consumables, what happens if all the following fields match another record in the stockroom?
• Assigned to
• Model
• Model category
• State
• Stockroom
• Substate

choices.D: The stock manager must merge the consumable records to create a blended quantity and cost
choices.C: The data is automatically created in a new record if the cost per item is more/less
choices.A: The stock manager must create a separate model record if the cost per item is more/less
choices.B: The data is automatically merged to create a blended quantity and cost

discussion.content: B, this is a simulator task for HAM on demand.

Selected Answer: B
Page 175 Vancouver

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
B is correct p173 of Tokyo Book

Selected Answer: B
Navigate to Self-Service > My Assets

Selected Answer: B
There is no "My Consumables" menu under Self-Service. Checked in a PDI.

Selected Answer: B
Impersonated as a user without roles allocated, the only option is My Assets to review

comments.content: No, this will take you to the list of ALL CONSUMABLES. My Assets module will show you only the ones that belong to you.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Correct Answer is not listed...should be "Navigate to Asset > Portfolios > Consumables

questions.question_text: How does an end user determine what consumables they have consumed?

choices.D: Navigate to Self-Service > My Hardware Asset Dashboard
choices.C: Navigate to Asset > Hardware Asset Dashboard

questions.question_text: When using transfer orders to move multiple assets from a single stockroom to another, how should each asset be listed?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Transfer Order Lines is a new module under Inventory with Template Tasks and Template Subtasks as the sub modules. Transfer order lines allow the transfer of multiple assets on one transfer order.

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/washingtondc-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/transfer-orders-for-am.html

Selected Answer: A
Page 188 of Vancouver HAM text.

Selected Answer: A
A. Each asset should be listed as a transfer order line on the transfer order

Selected Answer: A
Each asset should be listed as a transfer order line on the transfer order

Selected Answer: A
Its A is the answer

Selected Answer: A
Transfer order lines (displayed in a related list) allow the transfer of multiple assets on one transfer order.

choices.D: Each asset should be listed in an individual transfer order
choices.A: Each asset should be listed as a transfer order line on the transfer order
choices.B: Each asset should be listed in a transfer order task on the transfer order
choices.C: Each asset should be listed as a transfer order line on the transfer order task

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The asset(s) on the order line are released and they can be attached to another transfer order

Result tested in HAM Simulator.

Selected Answer: B
Marka's response is from page 188 of Vancouver text

Selected Answer: B
B
Cancellation of an order line releases the asset; cancellation can be performed until the asset ships
Deletion of a transfer order releases all assets on the order, and is only available until the order is flagged as Ready for fulfillment

Selected Answer: B
B. The asset(s) on the order line are released and they can be attached to another transfer order

Selected Answer: B
Its is B
Its is B

Selected Answer: B
State: In Stock , Substate: Available

questions.question_text: What happens to the associated assets when you cancel a transfer order line on a transfer order?

choices.D: A transfer order line cannot be cancelled once it is in a state of Ready for fulfillment
choices.B: The asset(s) on the order line are released and they can be attached to another transfer order
choices.A: The asset(s) on the order line are released, but their state remains Pre-allocated
choices.C: All assets on the transfer order are released, but their state remains Pre-allocated
choices.E: All assets on the transfer order are released and they can be attached to another transfer order

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer: C. As a single entity with a quantity of one

Explanation: Transferring assets between stockrooms
 - If an asset is consumable, it can be transferred and the quantity can be greater than one. Consumable parts are tracked by the system qualitatively.
 - If an asset is non-consumable, it must be transferred as a single entity with a quantity of one. Non-consumable parts correspond to assets defined in the system. (c.)

Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/transfer-orders-for-am.html

Selected Answer: C
Page 188 of Vancouver text.

Selected Answer: C
C. As a single entity with a quantity of one

C is correct. https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/transfer-orders-for-am.html

If an asset is non-consumable, it must be transferred as a single entity with a quantity of one.

C is correct
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-it-asset-management/page/product/asset-management/concept/transfer-orders-for-am.html

questions.question_text: When transferring non-consumable assets between stockrooms, how must they be transferred?

choices.C: As a single entity with a quantity of one
choices.B: No more than 10% of the source stockroom's inventory
